uh and i think that panned out here where i like this episode don't get me wrong but i wanted more i think from every different beat from every different angle right where it's like the comic was so much more from the zombies perspective giving us the like there's this amazing scene where zombie spider-man is crying about eating mary jane right like they wrestle with all this stuff that i wanted some of that in here so i think i wonder if somebody's just dropping in if it's going to be weird for them to have these zombies that have their powers and if what does that mean and how do you know what not that i i'm worried about that it was good i liked it it's another one where it's like not another one i guess it's one where it's like man i wish tom holland could have been here for this like this episode i think so hinges on spidey and the spidey voice actor does a great job but it is that same thing of like oh this kind of is not world breaking but i wish it was this that i think the

like oh they're going toward wakanda i would like to see it resolved i think this is one of the first ones i could have used 10 to 15 more minutes and i would not have been uh angry at that because you've got you know we're basically heading into the third act of a zombie film and it just wraps up and you see thanos and you're kind of left to your own devices to understand like oh okay well he's waiting there for them and they're bringing him the one thing he needs to basically end the universe um but having said that i'm a sucker for a zombie survival horror things like this and i think that you throw the the uh the superhero powers into it which when you start to think about it don't make a lot of sense because they're supposed to be mindless zombies how do they how does iron man know how to use the iron man suit but i don't care because it adds an extra dimension to it that makes it super fun um and i think it's super creative how they kind of whittle everyone down um especially

how to use the iron man suit but i don't care because it adds an extra dimension to it that makes it super fun um and i think it's super creative how they kind of whittle everyone down um especially like with the bruce banner part i think he hit for me where i was like oh is cool going to come out what's going to happen and the whole kind of like protects that one time he gets bit and he's like all right he's going to come out so um and then of course you know one of the the the hardest things to do in a zombie uh a flick or a zombie you know show is to have like kind of a big baddie and when they got to the vision section i was like oh that's so twisted that's so messed up and then scarlet witch like he's like everyone else who is you know uh you know susceptible to mind control except for her because her mind is too strong i can't i can't we can't stop her it's just like i i love stuff like that where like there's a train coming and you can't stop it no matter what so i enjoyed it

for her because her mind is too strong i can't i can't we can't stop her it's just like i i love stuff like that where like there's a train coming and you can't stop it no matter what so i enjoyed it not the best episode but i really enjoyed it yeah i also enjoyed it i i i'm with greg in the sense that like i yeah i grew up with the the marvel zombies so like that story is really cool and this kind of feels like a watered down version of it um same problems i've had with the whole series so far where it's it's a little too kid-like and and jokey like this in if this was done in a more serious way the entire episode would be very serious everyone would be extremely like depressed and somber and i kind of feel like that would have been a cool way to take it but instead we get lighthearted uh you know happy making jokes laying making jokes spider-man making jokes and i kind of feel like that you know takes away from the seriousness of everything so i kind of wish they had gone in a more

you know happy making jokes laying making jokes spider-man making jokes and i kind of feel like that you know takes away from the seriousness of everything so i kind of wish they had gone in a more serious route and i think that would have been interesting to do as a like a cartoon an animated thing um because we don't see that that often instead it continued that same path of like oh it's a cartoon everyone's having fun andy yeah i'm largely with kevin i i feel like um it did sort of water down the the seriousness of it and it largely felt like the murder mystery episode of boy meets world where you know people are getting killed all the time people are getting killed off but like who cares it's all fun like because next episode they'll all be back like that's kind of the vibe that i kept getting um and uh i don't know like as somebody who never really read comics and to have an episode like this just um obviously i saw it coming because of all the promotional material um coming out
